title: How to Spot and Avoid Phishing Attacks
description: Phishing is when scammers impersonate legitimate organizations to steal your personal information through fake emails, messages, or websites.
tips: Check sender email addresses carefully - scammers often use addresses that look similar to real ones
Never click on suspicious links in emails or messages - hover over links to see the real URL
Look for spelling and grammar mistakes in emails - legitimate companies proofread their communications
Be wary of urgent requests for personal information or money transfers
Verify requests by contacting the organization directly using official contact information
Enable two-factor authentication on all your important accounts
Keep your software and antivirus updated to protect against known threats

title: Protecting Yourself from Romance Scams
description: Romance scammers create fake profiles on dating sites and social media to build relationships and eventually ask for money.
tips: Be suspicious of people who profess strong feelings very quickly
Never send money to someone you've only met online, no matter the story
Watch for excuses why they can't meet in person or video chat
Be wary of people claiming to be overseas on military deployment or working abroad
Do a reverse image search of their profile pictures to check if they're stolen
Don't share intimate photos or videos that could be used for blackmail
Trust your instincts - if something feels wrong, it probably is
Report suspicious profiles to the dating platform immediately

title: Recognizing Investment and Ponzi Schemes
description: Investment frauds promise unrealistically high returns with little or no risk, often paying earlier investors with money from new investors.
tips: Be skeptical of any investment promising guaranteed high returns
Verify that the person or company is licensed to sell investments
Never invest based on social media ads or unsolicited calls alone
Understand that all legitimate investments carry some degree of risk
Be wary of pressure to invest immediately or keep the investment secret
Research the investment thoroughly and consult with a licensed financial advisor
Check if the investment is registered with regulatory authorities
Remember: if it sounds too good to be true, it probably is

title: Safeguarding Your Identity Online
description: Identity theft occurs when someone uses your personal information without permission to commit fraud or other crimes.
tips: Use strong, unique passwords for each online account
Enable two-factor authentication wherever possible
Monitor your bank and credit card statements regularly
Shred documents containing personal information before disposal
Be cautious about sharing personal information on social media
Only provide sensitive information on secure websites (look for https://)
Regularly check your credit report for unauthorized activity
Use a password manager to create and store complex passwords

title: Safe Online Shopping Practices
description: Online shopping fraud includes fake websites, non-delivery of goods, and counterfeit products.
tips: Only shop on secure websites with 'https://' in the URL
Research unfamiliar sellers and read customer reviews
Use credit cards or secure payment services instead of wire transfers
Be wary of deals that seem too good to be true
Avoid sellers who only accept unusual payment methods like gift cards or cryptocurrency
Check return and refund policies before purchasing
Save screenshots and receipts of your transactions
Be cautious of websites with poor design or numerous spelling errors

title: Cryptocurrency Scam Prevention
description: Crypto scams involve fraudulent investment schemes, fake exchanges, and phishing attacks targeting cryptocurrency holders.
tips: Never share your private keys or seed phrases with anyone
Use only reputable cryptocurrency exchanges and wallets
Be extremely skeptical of 'guaranteed returns' or 'double your crypto' offers
Verify URLs carefully - scammers create fake exchange websites
Don't trust investment advice from strangers on social media
Be wary of celebrity endorsements - many are fake or unauthorized
Research projects thoroughly before investing in new cryptocurrencies
Enable all available security features on your crypto accounts

title: Identifying and Avoiding Phone Scams
description: Phone scammers impersonate government officials, tech support, or banks to trick you into sending money or revealing personal information.
tips: Don't trust caller ID - scammers can fake phone numbers
Never give out personal or financial information over the phone
Hang up on robocalls and don't press any numbers
Be suspicious of threats, urgency, or requests for immediate payment
Verify the caller by hanging up and calling the organization's official number
Government agencies will never demand payment via gift cards or wire transfer
Register your number on the national Do Not Call registry
Report suspicious calls to your telecom provider and relevant authorities

title: Email Scam Red Flags
description: Email scams include phishing, business email compromise, and advance-fee fraud targeting individuals and businesses.
tips: Verify sender addresses carefully - look for subtle misspellings
Don't open attachments from unknown senders
Be cautious of unexpected invoices or payment requests
Watch for generic greetings like 'Dear Customer' instead of your name
Question emails creating a false sense of urgency
Never reply with sensitive information - contact the organization directly
Use email filters and mark suspicious emails as spam
Report phishing emails to your email provider and the impersonated organization
